Just for sake of curiosity, what would one need to do to make a modulemanager file to make stock aircraft parts armored? Definitely not as tough as the ground armor, but tough enough that good air-to-air dogfights are possible (when multiplayer comes . . . >:])

Or would you need to make multiple meshes/textures and basically whole new parts for the 'shot to pieces' look?

No clue about modulemanager. All the parts in your game will get included if you wanted to add some additional armour parts you could do that. All stock parts are considered mostly aluminum, so can't take too much punishment from anything larger than a 7.62mm - That doesn't mean it will fall apart on the first shot, but the likelihood of it becoming damaged is higher.

I'll likely make simple curved sheet armour to slap onto planes. Just realize that it will add mass so using it lightly around vital components will be the best option.

I've been toying with basic defensive AI for ships, not something that will likely be in the first release.

I really like the idea of having to add armor to craft. Not only is it more realistic, but it actually adds another layer of gameplay.

Can make light fast hitting craft, or heavy well armored but slow beasts of war!

Of all the mods Ive waited for to release, have to this one tops em! I have a whole install dedicated to kerbals fighting with this mod. Not even an alpha release and its already provided me with hour upon hour of gameplay and fun. Gonna be silly when I can put hands on the boom boom =)

Once its out Ill have to post pics of the most Kerbal sub-orbital weapon ever....the Suicide Drop Pod!!! Capable of decimating area ground targets...or getting a green dude pointlessly killed....we shall see!! WE.....SHALL..........SEE!

After being hit, checks are made and parts can catch fire, there are a lot of different conditional requirements. Fires can spread and some parts are not fire friendly...

The hit effect is a spark like effect that doesn't stick around too long, what you see in the pics is the is the small burning FX I made (on the aircraft with multiple instances) and on the ship is the larger one. I'll have different effects for different situations. One shoe does not fit all in this case
